captions.text:
Hi guys! I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I'm going to show

you how to make fresh lemonade from scratch.
It is incredibly simple, I mean once you see

the ingredients for it you're going to be
like "okay I can do this". You're really -

all you're going to need are some ice cubes,
some freshly squeezed lemon juice, water,

sugar, and some more water. But that's pretty
much it. The only thing I stress here is that

you must use fresh lemon juice. Don't use
the stuff that comes in a plastic tube. I

hate that stuff. It tastes like plastic. So,
the first thing we want to do is take our

sugar and some water and cook this together
until the sugar dissolves.

My sugar is just about melted into the water so now I'm going
to put my ice cubes right in here with the

rest of the water. And don't ask me why I
put ice cubes, you know this is a family recipe

that we do - we make every single year and
all summer long so, in like a lot of things

that I see - that anything that my grandmom
makes, she always puts ice cubes instead of

all water and I don't get why. So, all I did
was just stain the lemon juice because I don't

want all the little pits to go in there. And
now I'm going to just pour in the hot simple

syrup. And you're not going to drink this
hot, this is going to go into the fridge for

a few hours to chill this. But I'm going to
just give it a sneak little taste because

I don't want to sit here for the next, you
know, two to three hours. Just give it a stir.

I'm just going to give this a little tiny
taste just to make sure its sweet enough.

Oh that is so on point. There is no changes
to be made to this recipe. Now our time here

is up because I'm just going to put this in
the fridge to cool in time for dinner. But

that's just about it. Its simple; its easy;
you can make it in no time. To get the recipe

for it go to www.laurainthekitchen.com along
with plenty of other recipes that will go

great with this particular one. I'll see you
next time, bye!

title: Homemade Lemonade Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 409

comments.text:
Easy. Cheap. Delicious. I always drink it during the summer time.
And if you want it a bit more "exotic" just add some lime juice or whatever 
juice you like (I recommend strawberry juice for strawberry lemonade).

Oh, and when it´s really hot outside use crushed ice, sparkling water 
(important), cut some mint leaves and add them - Legendary refreshing!  =P

Greetings from germany. ;)﻿

comments.text:
All you do to make it pink is add a splash of juice to the pitcher. 
Pomegranate juice works well. Add a little for light pink, or more for a 
darker pink. Any red juice will work, doesn't have to be a specific kind. 
You might try to find strawberry juice, or just juice your own strawberries 
and add it. mash them as much as you can till they get soupy and strain the 
juice into your lemonaid.

comments.text:
LAURAS LEMONADE Ingredients: 1 cup Water 1 cup Sugar 1 1/4 cups of Lemon 
Juice 5 cups of Water 2 1/2 cups of Ice Process, 1) Add the one cup of 
water and one cup of sugar in a small saucepan and cook it over medium low 
heat until the sugar dissolves. 2) In a large pitcher, add in the remaining 
ingredients along with the simple syrup mixture. 3) Give it a good stir and 
pop it in the fridge for a couple hours to chill well.

comments.text:
Just tried this recipe and it tasted wonderful! or so i thought, the 
initial taste is delicious and refreshing. Then the after taste comes and 
it tastes like I ate a whole tablespoon of salt.. I'm not sure whether or 
not its because I had no fresh lemons available so I used preserved lemon 
juice. If you are going to try this recipe, I suggest using fresh lemon 
juice and seeing if it tastes better. I will try the recipe again. Thank 
you anyways Laura!
